articles.headline: Auto Industry Feels the Pain of Tight Credit
articles.snippet: Squeezed by the credit crunch and the softening economy, the American auto industry faces what may be its worst year in more than a decade.
articles.abstract: Squeezed by the credit crunch and the softening economy, the American auto industry faces what may be its worst year in more than a decade.
articles.lead_paragraph: The auto industry is getting sideswiped by the housing crisis.

articles.headline: Border Agents, Lured by the Other Side
articles.snippet: Scores of corruption cases in recent years have alarmed Homeland Security officials just as it is hiring thousands of border agents to stem the flow of illegal immigration.
articles.abstract: Scores of corruption cases in recent years have alarmed Homeland Security officials just as it is hiring thousands of border agents to stem the flow of illegal immigration.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN DIEGO  The smuggler in the public service announcement sat handcuffed in prison garb, full of bravado and shrugging off the danger of bringing illegal immigrants across the border.
articles.byline: By Randal C. Archibold and Andrew Becker

articles.headline: Rockefellers Seek Change at Exxon
articles.snippet: A shareholder move supported by the Rockefeller family is prodding Exxon Mobil to shift its priorities and take the threat of global warming more seriously.
articles.abstract: A shareholder move supported by the Rockefeller family is prodding Exxon Mobil to shift its priorities and take the threat of global warming more seriously.
articles.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON  The Rockefeller family built one of the great American fortunes by supplying the nation with oil. Now history has come full circle: some family members say it is time to start moving beyond the oil age.

articles.headline: Phone Giant in Germany Stirs a Furor
articles.snippet: Deutsche Telekom surreptitiously tracked thousands of phone calls to identify the source of leaks to the news media about its internal affairs.
articles.abstract: Deutsche Telekom surreptitiously tracked thousands of phone calls to identify the source of leaks to the news media about its internal affairs.
articles.lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT  Germany was engulfed in a national furor over threats to privacy on Monday, after an admission by Deutsche Telekom that it had surreptitiously tracked thousands of phone calls to identify the source of leaks to the news media about its internal affairs.

articles.headline: Soaring Fuel Prices Take a Withering Toll on Truckers
articles.snippet: Thousands of truckers are selling used rigs in what appears to be the biggest shakeout since trucking was deregulated in 1980.
articles.abstract: Thousands of truckers are selling used rigs in what appears to be the biggest shakeout since trucking was deregulated in 1980.
articles.lead_paragraph: As his logging business expanded in the pine and hardwood forests of eastern Georgia, Jesse Hendley got into trucking. He scraped together the cash gradually to acquire seven tractor-trailers so that he could not only sell timber to mills in the south, but also charge the mills for delivery.

articles.headline: Atomic Monitor Signals Concern Over Iran’s Work
articles.snippet: The report by the U.N. nuclear watchdog said that Iran’s suspected research into developing nuclear warheads remains “a matter of serious concern.”
articles.abstract: The report by the U.N. nuclear watchdog said that Iran’s suspected research into developing nuclear warheads remains “a matter of serious concern.”
articles.lead_paragraph: PARIS  The International Atomic Energy Agency, in an unusually blunt and detailed report, said Monday that Iran’s suspected research into the development of nuclear weapons remained “a matter of serious concern” and that Iran continued to owe the agency “substantial explanations.”

articles.headline: On the Court and on the Trail, One Aide Looms Over Obama
articles.snippet: Reggie Love, Barack Obama’s assistant, knows a thing or two about the preferences of “the boss.”
articles.abstract: Reggie Love, Barack Obama’s assistant, knows a thing or two about the preferences of “the boss.”
articles.lead_paragraph: In the last year, Barack Obama has learned a thing or two about running for president, and Reggie Love has learned a thing or two about Barack Obama.

articles.headline: Contractors Are Kept Busy Maintaining Abandoned Homes
articles.snippet: It can take months, even years, for some homes to wind through the foreclosure process, and decay sets in.
articles.abstract: It can take months, even years, for some homes to wind through the foreclosure process, and decay sets in.
articles.lead_paragraph: JACKSONVILLE, Fla.  The house on East 24th Street was the worst of the six that David Law and Trey McCallister worked on the other day here. The front door had been kicked in so many times that the dead bolt was exposed and bent. Trash littered the front and back yards. A copper pipe was gone.

articles.headline: S.E.C. Backs Health Care Balloting
articles.snippet: The Securities and Exchange Commission, shifting its position, has told companies they must allow shareholders to vote on a proposal for universal health insurance coverage.
articles.abstract: The Securities and Exchange Commission, shifting its position, has told companies they must allow shareholders to vote on a proposal for universal health insurance coverage.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The Securities and Exchange Commission, shifting its position, has told companies they must allow shareholders to vote on a proposal for universal health insurance coverage.
